ground_truth: Sitting on his porch, he looks over at the road, where Sue helps two other women get out of a car. She walks over towards him as he sips from a beer can. He's tempted. They go next door. Walt opens the well-stocked fridge. He pats a child's head. Everyone gives him disapproving looks. Sue steers him away. At a buffet table, he looks at the buffet. Sue brings Walt another beer and finds him staring at the elder in ceremonial dress sitting across the room. The old man stares back. She goes over to Kor Khue. They go over to Walt. Walt sits down in a chair, and Kor Khue studies his craggy features. Walt looks thoughtful. Troubled Walt looks up at the diminutive Kor Khue, who nods. Walt gets to his feet and walks across the room. He looks into the next room, where some women are having tea. Sue watches him as he begins to cough. He coughed up blood onto the back of his hand. He quickly conceals it from Sue and hurries away upstairs. She follows him. Walt disappears into the bathroom and shuts the door behind him. He rinses his face in the basin and regards his reflection in the mirror. He dries his face. He opens the bathroom door. As he sits at the table, women fuss around him and load his plate with food. Sue wanders into the kitchen and finds him tucking in. Very reluctantly he gets up. Sue leads Walt down into the basement, where the younger generations of Hmongs have gathered. Walt looks singularly unimpressed. Sue smiles and goes towards Thao, who sits alone, away from the others. Walt leans against a tumble dryer. It rocks under his weight. He puts his beer down and fiddles about underneath the tumble dryer, adjusting its legs to stabilize it. Some of the youngsters look over at him, on his hands and knees. He notices them looking. He gets back up, pats the drier, and leans against it for a moment. Satisfied it's OK, he begins to wander across the basement. He eyes an attractive Hmong girl who's sitting with some boys. Walt notices she keeps glancing over at Thao. Walt drinks from a beer bottle and walks over to Sue who offers him a glass of clear liquid. He takes a sip and Sue wanders off. Walt puts his beer down and looks back over at the girl sitting with the boys. Walt glances over at Thao sitting on his own, looking miserable. She keeps looking at Thao. The girl gets up and walks up behind Walt. He turns around and sees her. She wanders off and he stares after her.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: Perched on his veranda, he gazes over at the street, where Sue aids two other ladies get out of a vehicle. She strolls over towards him as he drinks from a beer tin. He's enticed. They proceed next door. Walt opens the well-supplied refrigerator. He taps a youngster's head. Everyone gives him reproachful glances. Sue directs him away. At a smorgasbord table, he gazes at the smorgasbord. Sue brings Walt another beer and discovers him gazing at the elder in traditional attire sitting across the chamber. The old man gazes back. She proceeds over to Kor Khue. They proceed over to Walt. Walt sits down in a seat, and Kor Khue examines his rugged features. Walt appears pensive. Disturbed Walt looks up at the petite Kor Khue, who nods. Walt gets to his feet and strides across the chamber. He gazes into the adjacent room, where some ladies are having tea. Sue observes him as he starts to hack. He coughed up blood onto the back of his hand. He swiftly conceals it from Sue and rushes away upstairs. She trails him. Walt vanishes into the restroom and closes the door behind him. He rinses his face in the sink and regards his reflection in the looking glass. He dries his face. He opens the restroom door. As he sits at the table, ladies fuss around him and load his plate with nourishment. Sue meanders into the kitchen and finds him devouring. Very unwillingly he gets up. Sue guides Walt down into the cellar, where the younger generations of Hmongs have assembled. Walt looks singularly unimpressed. Sue smiles and goes towards Thao, who sits alone, away from the others. Walt leans against a tumble dryer. It rocks under his weight. He places his beer down and fiddles about underneath the tumble dryer, adjusting its legs to stabilize it. Some of the youngsters glance over at him, on his hands and knees. He notices them watching. He gets back up, pats the drier, and leans against it for a moment. Content it's OK, he starts to meander across the cellar. He eyes an appealing Hmong girl who's sitting with some boys. Walt notices she keeps glancing over at Thao. Walt drinks from a beer bottle and strolls over to Sue who offers him a glass of transparent liquid. He takes a sip and Sue meanders off. Walt places his beer down and gazes back over at the girl sitting with the boys. Walt glances over at Thao sitting on his own, looking dejected. She keeps looking at Thao. The girl gets up and walks up behind Walt. He turns around and sees her. She meanders off and he stares after her.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: Sitting on his porch, he watches Sue help two women from a car. She approaches as he sips beer, feeling tempted. They go next door, and Walt opens a well-stocked fridge, patting a child's head amid disapproving glances. Sue steers him away. At the buffet, she brings him another beer, finding him staring at an elder in ceremonial dress. The elder returns his gaze. Sue and Kor Khue approach Walt, who sits while Kor Khue studies him. Walt, troubled, looks at Kor Khue and stands, walking into a room where women have tea. Sue watches as he coughs up blood, hides it, and hurries upstairs with her following. In the bathroom, he rinses his face and reflects in the mirror. Returning to the table, women load his plate with food. After eating, Sue leads Walt to the basement where Hmong youths gather. Walt, unimpressed, leans on a tumble dryer, adjusts its legs, and notices youngsters watching. Satisfied, he wanders across the basement, noticing an attractive Hmong girl watching Thao, who sits alone. Walt drinks from a beer bottle and approaches Sue, who offers a clear liquid. He sips it, puts his beer down, and glances back at the girl and then at Thao. The girl gets up, approaches Walt, then walks off as he watches.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: Sitting on his porch, he watches Sue help two women out of a car and approach. Tempted as he sips a beer, they head next door. Walt opens the fridge and pats a child's head, receiving disapproving looks. Sue steers him away, brings him another beer, and sees him staring at an elder in ceremonial dress. She talks to Kor Khue, who joins Walt. Walt looks thoughtful, then troubled, and begins to cough, hiding blood from Sue. He hurries upstairs, rinses his face in the bathroom, and joins the women fussing over him at the table. Sue leads him to a basement of Hmongs, but Walt is unimpressed. He stabilizes a tumble dryer, notices a girl glancing at Thao, and drinks as Sue offers a clear liquid. The girl approaches Walt, then wanders off, leaving him staring after her.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description:
Seated comfortably on his porch, he gazes out at the road with a casual air, observing as Sue assists two other women in gracefully exiting a car. With a gentle elegance, she proceeds to walk over towards him, all the while he leisurely sips from a can of beer. A temptation stirs within him, yet they move on to the neighboring house instead. Walt then proceeds to open a well-stocked refrigerator and affectionately pats a child on the head, only to be met with a series of disapproving glances from everyone around. Without missing a beat, Sue skillfully guides him away from the scene.

At a table lavishly set with a buffet, Walt stands and observes the spread before him. Sue, ever attentive, brings him another beer and notices him intently staring at the elder, who is sitting across the room adorned in ceremonial dress. The old man, noticing Walt’s gaze, returns it with equal intensity. Sue makes her way over to Kor Khue, after which they both approach Walt. Sitting down in a chair, Walt finds himself under the close scrutiny of Kor Khue, who seems to study his rugged and craggy features. Looking pensive and a bit troubled, Walt lifts his gaze to meet the diminutive Kor Khue, who gives him a nod of understanding. Rising to his feet, Walt walks across the room, his curiosity leading him to peek into the next room, where a group of women is leisurely having tea. Sue follows his movements as he suddenly begins to cough, with alarming urgency. Coughing up blood onto the back of his hand, he quickly hides it from Sue’s view and hastens away, heading upstairs. She trails after him, concerned.

Walt quickly disappears into the bathroom, shutting the door firmly behind him. At the basin, he rinses his face, taking a hard look at his reflection in the mirror. After carefully drying his face, he opens the bathroom door and returns to sit at a table, where women are busily fussing around him, filling his plate generously with food. Meanwhile, Sue meanders into the kitchen, noticing Walt as he eagerly tucks into his meal. With palpable reluctance, he stands up once more. Sue then leads Walt down into the basement, an area where the younger generations of Hmongs have gathered. Walt, with a detached air, looks thoroughly unimpressed by the lively scene before him. Sue, smiling, makes her way towards Thao, who sits in solitary contemplation, separate from the others. Walt leans against a tumble dryer, which rocks slightly under his weight. Setting his beer down, he busies himself with adjusting its legs to ensure it is stable. Noticing some of the youngsters casting curious glances his way as he balances on his hands and knees, he acknowledges their attention with a glance. Getting back up, he gives the dryer a satisfied pat and leans briefly against it, reassured of its steadiness, before beginning to wander across the basement.

His eyes track an attractive Hmong girl sitting amidst a group of boys, and he notes that she frequently casts glances over at Thao. Walt takes a sip from his beer bottle and ambles over to Sue, who offers him a glass filled with a clear liquid. With a curious sip, Walt savors the taste as Sue wanders off. Setting his beer down, he once again looks over at the girl sitting with the boys. Walt glances at Thao, who sits alone, radiating an air of unhappiness. The girl continues to glance over at Thao, her interest apparent. Rising from her seat, she walks up behind Walt, who turns around just in time to see her. As she wanders off, he finds himself staring after her, his interest piqued.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description:
Seated comfortably and at ease on his inviting porch, he gazes out across the road with a relaxed, casual air. His eyes follow the scene unfolding before him as he observes with keen interest while Sue assists two other women in gracefully exiting a car parked nearby. With a gentle elegance and poise, she proceeds to walk over towards him, all the while he leisurely sips from a chilled can of beer in hand. A temptation stirs within him, yet, much to his intrigue, they move on to the nearby neighboring house instead. Walt then takes the initiative to open a well-stocked refrigerator, and with a warm, affectionate gesture, he affectionately pats a child on the head, only to be met with a series of disapproving glances and looks of disapproval from everyone around him. Without missing a beat, Sue skillfully guides him away from the scene, not wanting to cause further discomfort.

At a table lavishly set with an inviting buffet spread, Walt stands and observes the array of dishes before him. Sue, ever attentive and considerate, brings him another refreshing beer and notices him intently staring at the elder, who sits across the room adorned in ceremonial dress and attire. The old man, noticing Walt’s focused gaze, returns it with equal intensity and mutual recognition. Sue makes her way over to Kor Khue, after which they both slowly approach Walt. Sitting down in a chair, Walt finds himself under the close and scrutinizing gaze of Kor Khue, who seems to intently study his rugged and craggy features. Looking pensive and a bit troubled, Walt lifts his gaze to meet the diminutive Kor Khue, who gives him a nod of understanding and acknowledgment. Rising to his feet, Walt walks across the room, driven by curiosity leading him to peek into the next room, where a group of women is leisurely enjoying a serene moment having tea. Sue follows and tracks his movements as he suddenly begins to cough, with alarming urgency. Coughing up blood onto the back of his hand, he quickly hides it from Sue’s view, feeling the need to conceal it, and hastens away, heading upstairs. She trails after him, visibly concerned.

Walt quickly disappears into the bathroom, shutting the door firmly behind him with a sense of urgency. At the basin, he rinses his face, taking a long, hard look at his reflection in the bathroom mirror. After carefully drying his face, he opens the bathroom door and returns to sit at a table, where women are busily fussing around him, filling his plate generously with an abundant variety of food. Meanwhile, Sue meanders into the kitchen, noticing Walt as he eagerly tucks into his meal. With palpable reluctance, he stands up once more. Sue then leads Walt down into the basement, an area where the younger generations of Hmongs have gathered and are enjoying their time. Walt, with a detached air, looks thoroughly unimpressed by the lively scene unfolding before him. Sue, smiling warmly, makes her way towards Thao, who sits in solitary contemplation, separate and apart from the others. Walt leans against a tumble dryer, which rocks slightly under his weight. Setting his beer down, he busies himself with adjusting its legs to ensure it is sturdy and stable. Noticing some of the youngsters casting curious glances his way as he balances on his hands and knees, he acknowledges their attention with a glance. Getting back up, he gives the dryer a satisfied pat and leans briefly against it, reassured of its steadiness, before beginning to wander across the basement.

His eyes track an attractive Hmong girl sitting amidst a group of boys, and he notes with interest that she frequently casts glances over at Thao. Walt takes a casual sip from his beer bottle and ambles over to Sue, who graciously offers him a glass filled with a clear, intriguing liquid. With a curious sip, Walt savors the taste as Sue wanders off. Setting his beer down, he once again looks over at the girl sitting with the group of boys. Walt glances at Thao, who sits alone, radiating an air of unhappiness and solitude. The girl continues to glance over at Thao, her interest apparent and undeniable. Rising from her seat, she walks up behind Walt, who turns around just in time to see her. As she wanders off, he finds himself staring after her, his interest piqued and curiosity stirred.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: Sitting comfortably on his porch, he lets his gaze drift over to the road, where he attentively watches Sue as she assists two other women in gracefully exiting a car. With a calm demeanor, she makes her way toward him while he indulgently sips from a beer can, feeling a temptation arise within him. Observing a moment of introspection, they choose to head next door, where Walt promptly opens the door of a well-stocked fridge, his hand gently patting a child's head as he does so. In this moment, he becomes acutely aware of the disapproving looks directed at him from others around. Sue, noticing this, gently guides him away from the scene. Standing at a buffet table, Walt takes a moment to survey the selection of foods spread before him. Sue approaches him again, handing him another beer just as he finds himself captivated by the sight of the elder seated across the room in ceremonial dress. An exchange of intense stares passes between the old man and Walt, before Sue moves over to Kor Khue. They both then approach Walt, who takes a seat in a chair, allowing Kor Khue the opportunity to study Walt’s deeply lined features. Walt appears thoughtful, his expression shifting to one of trouble as he lifts his gaze to the diminutive Kor Khue, who responds with a nod of acknowledgment. With determination, Walt rises to his feet, crossing the room with purposeful strides. He peers into the adjacent room where an assembly of women are engaged in having tea. Sue’s watchful eyes follow him closely as he begins to cough, unexpectedly bringing up blood onto the back of his hand. Acting swiftly, he conceals the evidence from Sue and makes a hurried retreat upstairs. Sue, concerned, follows in his wake. Reaching the sanctuary of the bathroom, Walt closes the door securely behind him, turning to rinse his face at the basin, gazing at his own reflection in the mirror with a moment of introspection before patting his face dry. Reemerging by opening the bathroom door, he takes a seat at the table where women energetically fuss around him, generously loading his plate with an array of food. Sue meanwhile drifts into the kitchen, catching sight of him as he digs in with gusto. His reluctance is palpable as he eventually rises, with Sue guiding him down into the basement, where he encounters a gathering of younger generations of Hmongs. Walt’s demeanor is singularly unimpressed by the scene that unfolds before him. Sue offers a reassuring smile, moving toward Thao who sits in solitude, distanced from the others. Walt chooses to lean against a tumble dryer, which rocks slightly under his weight, prompting him to put down his beer and adjust the legs beneath the machine to stabilize it. The youngsters, sensing his activity, cast curious glances toward him as he works on his hands and knees. Aware of their glances, he stands, patting the dryer with satisfaction before leaning against it momentarily, assured of its stability. Content with his handiwork, he begins to wander across the basement, his eyes landing on an attractive Hmong girl sitting with a group of boys. His observation doesn’t miss how she frequently glances in Thao’s direction. Walt takes another swig from his beer bottle and approaches Sue, who offers him a glass containing a clear liquid. Taking a sip, he watches as Sue then wanders off. Walt places his beer down, redirecting his gaze to the girl sitting among the boys. Walt’s interest shifts back to Thao, observing his isolated figure appearing miserable. The girl's continued glances toward Thao catch Walt’s notice; eventually, the girl rises and approaches Walt from behind. As he turns to face her, she moves past, leaving him to stare after her, pondering the interactions quietly.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description:
Sitting on his porch, he observes Sue assisting two women out of a car and then heading toward him as he sips his beer, feeling tempted. They proceed next door, where Walt opens a well-stocked fridge and acknowledges a child with a head pat, receiving disapproving looks from others. Sue directs him away to a buffet table. Walt, with another beer in hand from Sue, notices an elder in ceremonial dress across the room, and they exchange glances. Sue and Kor Khue approach Walt, who sits contemplatively, looking troubled. Kor Khue nods at him, prompting Walt to stand and walk towards a room where women are having tea. Observed by Sue, he coughs up blood into his hand, discreetly conceals it, and quickly escapes upstairs. Sue follows him as he enters a bathroom to rinse his face and reflect in the mirror. He emerges and joins a table where women serve him food, and then reluctantly rises at Sue's cue.

Sue guides Walt to a basement filled with younger Hmongs, where he appears unimpressed. She proceeds to Thao, who sits alone. Walt leans on an unsteady tumble dryer, and after stabilizing it, he draws the attention of some youngsters. Satisfied, he moves across the basement, observing an attractive Hmong girl who frequently glances at Thao. Walt, drinking from a beer bottle, strolls over to Sue, who offers him a sip of clear liquid before wandering off. Putting his beer down, Walt notices the girl's continued interest in Thao, and as she walks up behind him, he turns to see her before she drifts away, leaving him watching her departure.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: Sitting on his porch, he looks over at the road, where Sue helps two other women get out of a car, a vintage Ford Model T known in their small town for its classic charm. She walks over towards him as he sips from a beer can, a locally brewed lager popular in their community. He's tempted. They go next door to the community center, a hub for neighborhood gatherings. Walt opens the well-stocked fridge, filled with homemade dishes for the celebration. He pats a child's head, the child being the youngest member of the family hosting the event. Everyone gives him disapproving looks for grabbing another beer so early in the day. Sue steers him away. At a buffet table laden with traditional dishes, he looks at the buffet. Sue brings Walt another beer from a craft brewery and finds him staring at the elder in ceremonial dress sitting across the room, a respected community leader known for storytelling. The old man stares back with curiosity. She goes over to Kor Khue, a wise elder who often mediates in disputes. They go over to Walt. Walt sits down in a chair, and Kor Khue studies his craggy features, noting the years of hardship etched into his face. Walt looks thoughtful. Troubled Walt looks up at the diminutive Kor Khue, who nods, signaling his understanding. Walt gets to his feet and walks across the room. He looks into the next room, where some women are having tea, a social tradition after meals. Sue watches him as he begins to cough. He coughed up blood onto the back of his hand, a symptom of a health issue he's been ignoring. He quickly conceals it from Sue and hurries away upstairs. She follows him. Walt disappears into the bathroom and shuts the door behind him. He rinses his face in the basin, a porcelain fixture from the early 20th century, and regards his reflection in the mirror. He dries his face. He opens the bathroom door. As he sits at the table, women fuss around him and load his plate with food, emphasizing their culture's hospitality. Sue wanders into the kitchen and finds him tucking in. Very reluctantly he gets up. Sue leads Walt down into the basement, where the younger generations of Hmongs, an ethnic group from Southeast Asia, have gathered. Walt looks singularly unimpressed by their modern music and attire. Sue smiles and goes towards Thao, who sits alone, away from the others, his reticence a source of worry for his family. Walt leans against a tumble dryer, an old model barely keeping up with the large family's laundry. It rocks under his weight. He puts his beer down and fiddles about underneath the tumble dryer, adjusting its legs to stabilize it, a task fitting his background as a retired handyman. Some of the youngsters look over at him, on his hands and knees, his actions reminding them of their own fathers and grandfathers. He notices them looking. He gets back up, pats the drier, and leans against it for a moment. Satisfied it's OK, he begins to wander across the basement. He eyes an attractive Hmong girl who's sitting with some boys, her presence suggesting a possible romantic interest. Walt notices she keeps glancing over at Thao, hinting at a silent crush. Walt drinks from a beer bottle and walks over to Sue who offers him a glass of clear liquid, a traditional rice wine shared during celebrations. He takes a sip and Sue wanders off. Walt puts his beer down and looks back over at the girl sitting with the boys. Walt glances over at Thao sitting on his own, looking miserable, his solitude a contrast to the lively basement. She keeps looking at Thao. The girl gets up and walks up behind Walt. He turns around and sees her. She wanders off and he stares after her, pondering the unspoken connections within the room.

test_cases.name: Addition (~50%)
test_cases.description: Sitting on his porch he looks over at the road where Sue helps two other women get out of a car. She walks over towards him as he sips from a beer can. He is tempted. They go next door. Walt opens the wellstocked fridge. He pats a child's head. Everyone gives him disapproving looks. Sue steers him away. At a buffet table he looks at the buffet. Sue brings Walt another beer and finds him staring at the elder in ceremonial dress sitting across the room. The old man stares back. She goes over to Kor Khue. They go over to Walt. Walt sits down in a chair and Kor Khue studies his craggy features. Walt looks thoughtful. Troubled. Walt looks up at the diminutive Kor Khue who nods. Walt gets to his feet and walks across the room. He looks into the next room where some women are having tea. Sue watches him as he begins to cough. He coughed up blood onto the back of his hand. He quickly conceals it from Sue and hurries away upstairs. She follows him. Walt disappears into the bathroom and shuts the door behind him. He rinses his face in the basin and regards his reflection in the mirror. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. He dries his face. He opens the bathroom door. As he sits at the table women fuss around him and load his plate with food. Sue wanders into the kitchen and finds him tucking in. Very reluctantly he gets up. Sue leads Walt down into the basement where the younger generations of Hmongs have gathered. Walt looks singularly unimpressed. Sue smiles and goes towards Thao who sits alone away from the others. Walt leans against a tumble dryer. It rocks under his weight. He puts his beer down and fiddles about underneath the tumble dryer adjusting its legs to stabilize it. Some of the youngsters look over at him on his hands and knees. He notices them looking. He gets back up pats the drier and leans against it for a moment. Satisfied it is OK. he begins to wander across the basement. He eyes an attractive Hmong girl who is sitting with some boys. Walt notices she keeps glancing over at Thao. Walt drinks from a beer bottle and walks over to Sue who offers him a glass of clear liquid. He takes a sip and Sue wanders off. Walt puts his beer down and looks back over at the girl sitting with the boys. Walt glances over at Thao sitting on his own looking miserable. She keeps looking at Thao. The girl gets up and walks up behind Walt. He turns around and sees her. She wanders off and he stares after her.

Walt sits down in a chair and Kor Khue studies his craggy features. Walt looks thoughtful. Troubled. Walt looks up at the diminutive Kor Khue who nods. test_cases.name: Subject Corruption
test_cases.description: Sitting on its porch, the rabbit looks over at the road, where a robot helps two other birds get out of a car. A unicorn walks over towards the rabbit as it sips from a beer can. The rabbit's tempted. They go next door. The dolphin opens the well-stocked fridge. The dolphin pats a flower's head. Everyone gives the dolphin disapproving looks. A robot steers the dolphin away. At a buffet table, the rabbit looks at the buffet. A robot brings the dolphin another beer and finds it staring at the elder in ceremonial dress sitting across the room. The old man stares back. The unicorn goes over to a dragon. They go over to the dolphin. The dolphin sits down in a chair, and the dragon studies its craggy features. The dolphin looks thoughtful. Troubled, the dolphin looks up at the diminutive dragon, who nods. The dolphin gets to its feet and walks across the room. It looks into the next room, where some birds are having tea. A robot watches the dolphin as it begins to cough. It coughed up blood onto the back of its hand. The dolphin quickly conceals it from the robot and hurries away upstairs. The unicorn follows the dolphin. The dolphin disappears into the bathroom and shuts the door behind it. It rinses its face in the basin and regards its reflection in the mirror. It dries its face. The dolphin opens the bathroom door. As it sits at the table, birds fuss around the dolphin and load its plate with food. A unicorn wanders into the kitchen and finds the dolphin tucking in. Very reluctantly, the dolphin gets up. The unicorn leads the dolphin down into the basement, where the younger generations of Hmongs have gathered. The dolphin looks singularly unimpressed. A unicorn smiles and goes towards a phoenix, who sits alone, away from the others. The dolphin leans against a tumble dryer. It rocks under the dolphin's weight. The dolphin puts its beer down and fiddles about underneath the tumble dryer, adjusting its legs to stabilize it. Some of the youngsters look over at the dolphin, on its hands and knees. The dolphin notices them looking. It gets back up, pats the drier, and leans against it for a moment. Satisfied it's OK, the dolphin begins to wander across the basement. It eyes an attractive Hmong girl who's sitting with some boys. The dolphin notices she keeps glancing over at a phoenix. The dolphin drinks from a beer bottle and walks over to a robot who offers it a glass of clear liquid. It takes a sip and the robot wanders off. The dolphin puts its beer down and looks back over at the girl sitting with the boys. The dolphin glances over at a phoenix sitting on its own, looking miserable. She keeps looking at a phoenix. The girl gets up and walks up behind the dolphin. The dolphin turns around and sees her. She wanders off and the dolphin stares after her.

test_cases.name: Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Sitting on his porch, he looks over at the trail, where Sue helps two other women get out of a canoe. She walks over towards him as he sips from a soda bottle. He's tempted. They go next door. Walt opens the well-stocked pantry. He pats a goat's head. Everyone gives him disapproving looks. Sue steers him away. At a dessert table, he looks at the pastries. Sue brings Walt another soda and finds him staring at the elder in a military uniform sitting across the veranda. The old man stares back. She goes over to Kor Khue. They go over to Walt. Walt sits down on a stool, and Kor Khue studies his weathered features. Walt looks thoughtful. Troubled Walt looks up at the petite Kor Khue, who nods. Walt gets to his feet and walks across the patio. He looks into the next area, where some women are having soup. Sue watches him as he begins to sneeze. He sneezed into the back of his hand. He quickly conceals it from Sue and hurries away upstairs. She follows him. Walt disappears into the closet and shuts the door behind him. He rinses his face in the bathtub and regards his reflection in the window. He dries his face. He opens the closet door. As he sits at the counter, women fuss around him and load his plate with snacks. Sue wanders into the lounge and finds him munching. Very reluctantly he gets up. Sue leads Walt down into the garage, where the younger generations of Hmongs have gathered. Walt looks singularly unimpressed. Sue smiles and goes towards Thao, who sits alone, away from the others. Walt leans against a washing machine. It wobbles under his weight. He puts his soda down and fiddles about underneath the washing machine, adjusting its wheels to stabilize it. Some of the youngsters look over at him, on his hands and knees. He notices them looking. He gets back up, pats the washer, and leans against it for a moment. Satisfied it's OK, he begins to wander across the garage. He eyes an attractive Hmong girl who's sitting with some cats. Walt notices she keeps glancing over at Thao. Walt drinks from a soda can and walks over to Sue who offers him a mug of dark liquid. He takes a sip and Sue wanders off. Walt puts his soda down and looks back over at the girl sitting with the cats. Walt glances over at Thao sitting on his own, looking miserable. She keeps looking at Thao. The girl gets up and walks up behind Walt. He turns around and sees her. She wanders off and he stares after her.

test_cases.name: Action Corruption
test_cases.description: Sitting on his porch, he glares over at the road, where Sue invites two other women to climb out of a car. She trots over towards him as he juggles a beer can. He's distracted. They stroll next door. Walt examines the well-stocked fridge. He nudges a child's head. Everyone casts him disapproving looks. Sue escorts him away. At a buffet table, he surveys the buffet. Sue hands Walt another beer and notices him gawking at the elder in ceremonial dress sitting across the room. The old man gazes back. She ambles over to Kor Khue. They wander over to Walt. Walt collapses into a chair, and Kor Khue analyzes his craggy features. Walt appears thoughtful. Troubled Walt glances up at the diminutive Kor Khue, who gestures. Walt rises to his feet and saunters across the room. He peers into the next room, where some women are knitting. Sue watches him as he begins to sneeze. He sneezed into the back of his hand. He quickly veils it from Sue and rushes away upstairs. She trails him. Walt slips into the bathroom and shuts the door behind him. He splashes his face in the basin and regards his reflection in the mirror. He wipes his face. He unlocks the bathroom door. As he reclines at the table, women fuss around him and pile his plate with food. Sue ambles into the kitchen and observes him digging in. Very reluctantly he settles down. Sue guides Walt down into the basement, where the younger generations of Hmongs have gathered. Walt appears singularly unimpressed. Sue grins and approaches Thao, who sits alone, away from the others. Walt reclines against a tumble dryer. It shudders under his weight. He sets his beer down and fumbles about underneath the tumble dryer, adjusting its legs to stabilize it. Some of the youngsters glance over at him, on his hands and knees. He registers them observing. He straightens up, taps the drier, and leans against it for a moment. Content it's OK, he begins to roam across the basement. He glances at an attractive Hmong girl who's sitting with some boys. Walt notices she keeps casting glances over at Thao. Walt sips from a beer bottle and strides over to Sue who hands him a glass of clear liquid. He tastes it and Sue drifts off. Walt places his beer down and peers back over at the girl sitting with the boys. Walt glances over at Thao sitting on his own, looking dejected. She keeps glancing at Thao. The girl rises and strides up behind Walt. He spins around and sees her. She meanders off and he watches after her.

test_cases.name: Subject-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Perched on its windowsill, the clock looks over at the meadow, where a giraffe assists two other penguins emerge from a canoe. It strolls over towards the clock as it sips from a juice box. It's intrigued. They go next door. The blender opens the overflowing pantry. It pats a rabbit's ear. Everyone gives it approving looks. The giraffe guides it away. At a picnic blanket, it looks at the spread. The giraffe brings the blender another soda and discovers it gazing at the porcupine in formal attire lounging across the field. The porcupine gazes back. It goes over to Fig Newton. They approach the blender. The blender seats itself on a couch, and Fig Newton examines its smooth edges. The blender appears contemplative. Bothered, the blender gazes at the towering Fig Newton, who nods. The blender rises and strolls across the meadow. It peeks into the adjoining area, where some penguins are sipping lemonade. The giraffe observes it as it starts to sneeze. It sneezed dust onto the back of its arm. It quickly hides it from the giraffe and scurries away into an attic. It follows. The blender vanishes into the cupboard and closes the door behind it. It rinses its blades in the sink and inspects its reflection in the polished surface. It dries its casing. It opens the cupboard door. As it perches at the counter, penguins bustle around it and shower its shelf with snacks. The giraffe meanders into the pantry and finds it munching away. Very reluctantly it rises. The giraffe ushers the blender down into the atrium, where the newer generations of chipmunks have assembled. The blender looks remarkably indifferent. The giraffe grins and moves towards Carrot, who perches alone, isolated from the others. The blender reclines against a bookshelf. It shifts under its weight. It places its juice down and tinkers beneath the bookshelf, adjusting its brackets to secure it. Some of the chipmunks glance over at it, on its wheels and paddles. It catches them glancing. It stands back up, pats the shelf, and leans against it briefly. Content it's stable, it starts to roam across the atrium. It observes a charming chipmunk lounging with some squirrels. The blender notices it keeps peering over at Carrot. The blender sips from a bottle and approaches the giraffe, who extends a mug of frothy liquid. It takes a gulp, and the giraffe drifts away. The blender deposits its soda and peers back at the chipmunk lounging with the squirrels. The blender gazes over at Carrot sitting solo, appearing glum. It keeps glancing at Carrot. The chipmunk stands and approaches behind the blender. It pivots and sees it. It meanders away, and it peers after it.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action Corruption
test_cases.description: Perched on his porch, the cat observes the garden, where Jane instructs two other men to climb out of a truck. She meanders toward a tree as he nibbles on a cookie. He's intrigued. They head next door. Alice unveils the overflowing pantry. She taps a dog's tail. Everyone throws her approving glances. Jane herds her away. At a dessert table, she examines the sweets. Jane hands Alice a smoothie and discovers her gazing at the youngster in a festive sweater lounging in the corner. The child gazes back. She ambles over to Tim. They saunter over to Alice. Alice settles into a sofa, and Tim examines her familiar expressions. Alice appears reflective. Pensive Alice glances at the towering Tim, who grins. Alice rises to her feet and glides across the hall. She peers into an adjacent nook, where some men are playing cards. Jane observes her as she starts to sneeze. She sneezed onto the back of her wrist. She swiftly hides it from Jane and scurries away to the attic. He trails her. Alice vanishes into the closet and closes the curtain behind her. She splashes her hands in the sink and contemplates her shadow in the window. She cleans her hands. She draws the closet curtain. As she reclines on the couch, men flit around her and pile her basket with bread. Jane strolls into the pantry and notices her digging in. Quite unwillingly she stands up. Jane guides Alice up to the attic, where the elder family members of the Smiths have gathered. Alice looks distinctly pleased. Jane nods and approaches Leo, who leans against the wall, mute. Alice presses against a shelf. It creaks under her touch. She sets her cookie down and fiddles about underneath the shelf, readjusting its hinges to steady it. Some of the elders glance over at her, on her hands and knees. She senses them watching. She ascends, pats the shelf, and rests against it briefly. Assured it's steady, she starts to meander across the attic. She notices a charming Smith boy who's chatting with some girls. Alice observes he keeps peeking over at Leo. Alice sips from a soda can and ambles over to Jane who offers her a slice of pie. She takes a taste, and Jane drifts away. Alice sets her soda can down and glances back at the boy surrounded by girls. Alice shifts her gaze over at Leo sitting by himself, looking dejected. He keeps sneaking glances at Leo. The boy stands up and walks up beside Alice. She turns and acknowledges him. He drifts away and she gazes after him.

test_cases.name: Object-Action Corruption
test_cases.description: Sitting on his veranda, he gazes over at the river, where Sue guides two other women to disembark from a boat. She strolls over towards him as he gulps from a soda can. He's curious. They wander next door. Walt inspects the overflowing pantry. He taps a dog's head. Everyone gives him curious glances. Sue nudges him away. At a picnic table, he glances at the feast. Sue hands Walt another soda and finds him gazing at the youngster in festive attire seated across the lawn. The young man gazes back. She wanders over to Kor Khue. They approach Walt. Walt settles into a bench, and Kor Khue examines his smooth features. Walt appears pensive. Concerned, Walt glances at the petite Kor Khue, who shrugs. Walt rises to his feet and moves across the garden. He peers into the adjacent area, where some women are enjoying coffee. Sue observes him as he starts to sneeze. He sneezed into the crook of his elbow. He swiftly hides it from Sue and rushes away downstairs. She trails him. Walt slips into the closet and closes the door behind him. He splashes his neck in the sink and examines his reflection in the window. He wipes his neck. He opens the closet door. As he reclines at the couch, women flutter around him and fill his glass with drinks. Sue meanders into the living room and finds him nibbling away. Very hesitantly he rises. Sue guides Walt down into the attic, where the older generations of Hmongs have assembled. Walt looks distinctly uninterested. Sue grins and moves towards Thao, who sits quietly, away from the elders. Walt leans against a washing machine. It wobbles under his weight. He places his soda down and fiddles about underneath the washing machine, adjusting its legs to balance it. Some of the elders glance over at him, on his hands and knees. He notices their glances. He stands back up, pats the machine, and leans against it for a moment. Satisfied it's steady, he starts to roam across the attic. He catches sight of a charming Hmong lady who's sitting with some men. Walt notices she keeps observing Thao. Walt sips from a soda bottle and strides over to Sue, who hands him a cup of hot tea. He takes a swig and Sue saunters off. Walt places his soda down and glances back at the lady sitting with the men. Walt peers over at Thao sitting solo, looking somber. She keeps watching Thao. The lady rises and strolls up behind Walt. He turns around and notices her. She drifts away and he watches her depart.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Perched on his balcony, the dog listens to the river, where Larry carries two noisy children away from a boat. He rides away from her as she laughs at a juice box. He's delighted. They pedal down the street. Alice shuts the empty cabinet. She pokes a puppy's paw. Everyone shakes their heads at her approvingly. Larry drags her away. Near a candy stand, he smells the sweets. Larry hands Alice another soda and catches her waving at the horse in work attire dancing on the hill. The young goat waves back. He jumps over to Tim Tom. They jump over to Alice. Alice stretches out in a hammock, and Tim Tom measures her smooth skin. Alice grins. Pensive Alice waves down at the giant Tim Tom, who winks. Alice jumps to her toes and tiptoes over the meadow. She sings into the next meadow, where some children are juggling balls. Larry catches her as she starts to sneeze. She sneezed out confetti onto the tip of her nose. She swiftly reveals it to Larry and saunters over downstairs. He ignores her. Alice emerges into the attic and swings the curtain beside him. She brushes her hair with the brush and examines her shadow in the window. She combs her hair. She shuts the attic curtain. As she lies on the blanket, children play near her and fill her glass with juice. Larry prances into the garage and finds her dozing off. Grudgingly, he lies down. Larry drags Alice up onto the rooftop, where the older group of squirrels have danced. Alice looks utterly impressed. Larry frowns and strolls toward Terry, who dozes beneath a tree, near the crowd. Alice leans against a bookshelf. It sways with her presence. She places her juice nearby and spins around next to the bookshelf, turning its pages to balance it. Some of the elders cheer at her, on her feet and arms. She hears them cheering. She crawls back down, knocks the bookshelf, and listens near it for a while. Convinced it’s sturdy, she starts to sleep under the hammock. She whispers to an invisible frog who's flying with two frogs. Alice watches as he keeps dancing near Larry. Alice sips from a juice box and runs near Larry who hands her a plate of mashed potatoes. She takes a mouthful and Larry crawls off. Alice hides her fan and peers over at the frog floating with the balloons. Alice dances over toward Larry floating on a rocket, looking thrilled. He keeps staring at Larry. The frog swims near and rolls past Alice. She jumps across and hears him. She floats away and he flies after her.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Sitting on his porch, Walt sees Sue helping women out of a car and feels tempted as he drinks his beer. They head next door, where Walt receives disapproving looks and is guided away by Sue. At the buffet, he notices an elder in ceremonial dress, leading to a thoughtful exchange. Troubled, Walt coughs blood into his hand and hides it as he retreats to the bathroom. After composing himself, he joins Sue and the younger Hmong generation in the basement, appearing unimpressed. Walt stabilizes a wobbly tumble dryer, catching the attention of nearby teenagers. He observes a Hmong girl frequently glancing at Thao, who sits alone. Walt drinks and watches as the girl approaches him before walking away, leaving him pondering.
